Node

Contents

  • Creating a Node
  • Adding a node as a child of another node
  • Adding a node as a parent of another node
  • Adding multiple nodes as children of another node
  • Adding multiple nodes as parents of another node
  • Removing a parent from a child node (equivalently removing child node from the parent node) 
from cdcm import Node

Node#

Node is the fundamental buidling block of the graph which represents a system in CDCM. All the components of the system will be represented as a Node object or object which inherits the Node. Node has attributes:
name: The name of the object.
description: The description of the object.
parents: The parents of the node. These are the nodes which affect the node.
children: The children of the node. These are the nodes affected by the node.
owner: The owner of the node. This can be the system of which the node is part of.
Following are some of the useful functionalities provided by the Node class:

Creating a Node#

# A node n1 is created
n1 = Node(name="n1")
# A node n2 is created
n2 = Node(name="n2")
print(n1)
print(n2)

# Let us create more nodes
n3 = Node(name="n3")
n4 = Node(name="n4")
n5 = Node(name="n5")
n6 = Node(name="n6")
n7 = Node(name="n7")
n8 = Node(name="n8")

n1:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ()

n2:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ()

Adding a node as a child of another node#

# n2 is added as a child of n1. This action implies n2 depends on n1.
n1.add_child(n2)
print(n1)
print(n2)

n1:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ('n2',)

n2:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ('n1',)
  children: ()

Adding a node as a parent of another node#

n3.add_parent(n1)
n3.add_parent(n4)
print(n1)
print(n2)
print(n3)
print(n4)

n1:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ('n2', 'n3')

n2:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ('n1',)
  children: ()

n3:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ('n1', 'n4')
  children: ()

n4:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ('n3',)

Adding multiple nodes as children of another node#

# First, adding just one
n4.add_children(n5)
print(n4)

n4:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ('n3', 'n5')

# Add from a sequence
n4.add_children([n6, n7])
print(n4)

n4:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ('n3', 'n5', 'n6', 'n7')

Adding multiple nodes as parents of another node#

n6.add_parents([n7, n8])
print(n6)

n6:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ('n4', 'n7', 'n8')
  children: ()

Removing a parent from a child node (equivalently removing child node from the parent node)#

print("Before removing parent n1 from n3:")
print(n1)
print(n3)
print("After removing parent n1 from n3:")
n1.remove_child(n3) # same as n3.remove_parent(n1)
print(n1)
print(n3)

Before removing parent n1 from n3:
n1:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ('n2', 'n3')

n3:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ('n1', 'n4')
  children: ()

After removing parent n1 from n3:
n1:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ('n2',)

n3:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ('n4',)
  children: ()

n3.remove_parent(n4)
n6.remove_parent(n4)
print(n3)
print(n4)

n3:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ()

n4:
  description: ''
  owner: ''
  parents: ()
  children: ('n5', 'n7')
